item.title: Convergence Update, Call for Workshops
item.content_encoded:
- To attend this summer’s CrimethInc. convergence, show up July 16 at Gordon Park (Locust St. & Humboldt Blvd) in Milwaukee, WI. You can also show up July 17, but you’ll miss some of the events. The CrimethInc. convergence is a self-organized gathering to circulate skills, deepen networks, and build morale in North America in order to foster a culture of resistance worldwide. Everyone who comes is encouraged to be a presenter and performer. This year’s convergence will focus on developing direct action skills such as might be useful at the Democratic and Republican National Conventions this summer, and also on creative pastimes, subversive ideas, and survival strategies that have nothing to do with them. Anarchists from overseas will also be present to offer perspectives from other contexts. Like previous convergences, this one will be a sober, consent-based, anticapitalist space. That means no drugs or drinking on the premises; accountability processes will be in effect according to the wishes of survivors; and that camping, eating, literature, and everything else are totally free (though participants are discouraged from selling things except to raise funds for political prisoners). We’ll have more details on the policies stipulated by the local organizers shortly. Bring camping gear, food, arts and crafts materials, literature to share, plays to perform, workshops to present, songs to sing, poetry to recite, stunts to pull off, plans to whisper, and the sort of wild-eyed romantic idealism that can make the most boring situation into a crazy adventure. Childcare, medical services, and conflict mediation will all be provided. RSVP: crimethincbooking@yahoo.com Contact the local organizers: blowedupwisconsin@gmail.com Please download promotional materials to invite people from your community. CrimethInc. reports from some previous convergences: 2007 : 2006 : 2004 : 2003 Corporate media reporting on previous convergences—mind you, these are generally of dubious merit: Harper’s : Elle : Athens News : Winona Daily News

Call for Workshops

If you are planning on performing or presenting this year, please send in a brief description of what you’ll be doing, so we can announce it in advance. Email it to crimethincbooking@yahoo.com. We encourage everyone to see the CrimethInc. convergence as a space to try out ideas that would never see the light in any other context. This is a chance to risk everything, to debut brand new formats with your knees knocking together in terror! Don’t just drone through the old standards—challenge yourself and others! Draw on your passions and anomalous interests to offer your comrades points of departure they would never come across anywhere else, including in other anarchist circles. If your two true loves are lobsters and William Blake, put on a puppet show: Songs of Experience as Interpreted by Creatures of the Deep! If you’re quite comfortable discussing post-structuralist theory, try something you’ve never done before—put on a burlesque show, or do the research for a presentation on the history of anti-state responses to domestic violence, or volunteer at the childcare station all week! If we are careful and conservative in spaces like this that belong to us, we’re bound to stay careful and conservation in the rest of our lives, too. GO FOR IT! Here are a few examples of this year’s workshops and performances. We’ll post more as they come in! Publishing A Small Periodical Newspaper A comprehensive crash-course in the production of a community newspaper: learn how you and 3 or 4 friends can publish a small-scale newspaper or community journal! Covers outreach-writing methodology, theme-selection, presentation, and distribution. This workshop covers the nuts and bolts of newspaper projects; the "Small Town Organizing" workshop functions well as a complement. Small Town Organizing for Anarchists Do you feel stuck—like you're running in place—in a small town? Come share your experience and hear insight from our work in the field: this workshop offers a walking tour through strategic models for mutual-aid outreach, DIY-community building, public relations, literature distribution, broader network health, and morale boosting. We’ll also tackle such obstacles as poor social dynamics within small-town DIY communities, practical consensus for beginners, and how small and well-known anarchist cells can avoid being singled out as criminals. Designing Posters and Other Propaganda This workshop isn't for designers only; rather, we'll take a look at conventional anarchist design methods and style and analyze their effectiveness in communicating meaning. In addition to theory, this workshop includes some basic tutorials for both old (cut & paste) and new (digital design) schools, and offers some useful instances for both. This workshop emphasizes utilizing equipment and resources that are freely accessible to most people. Storytelling Revisited Security Culture meets Resistance Mythology in this dynamic workshop of storytelling and storytelling about storytelling. Learn about the elements and sequence of a good story, about the fascinating characteristics of compelling characters, enjoy irony and satire in their natural habitat, and consider how to escape moralism and encourage appreciation for good stories at the same time. Learn how to utilize these ingredients to talk your way across a border or into a building; learn how good storytelling—and listening—skills can protect participants in direct actions and simultaneously nurture momentum for resistance. Direct Action Planning: Mock Spokescouncil In this exercise, participants will break into affinity groups to plan a mock action via the spokescouncil model. Excellent practice for publicly coordinated actions that demand layers of privacy within and between groups. Direct Action Role-Playing: Staying Safe in the Streets This workshop offers real-time, real-space experience for groups to move securely together in stressful situations, to protect themselves against attacks, avoid being boxed in, stay aware in changing environments, and achieve objectives. Performer: Testament I am not a rapper, I am just a revolutionary who raps good. I'm taking hip-hop back to its revolutionary roots and spreading dissent through the powerful, thought-provoking rhymes. I'm here to save hip-hop from the glorified violence, materialism, sexism, and racism that the music industry creates, promotes, and markets for their own capitalist purposes. The revolution will not be signed to a record deal. In lieu of a ride board, please post offers of and requests for empty seats to the convergence in the comments section below.

wp_comment.wp_comment_content: When will there be a CrimethInc convention in NYC?

Some things to keep in mind when preparing your journey to this year's convergence (from Milwaukee Indymedia)
Dear would-be Crimethinc Convergence attendees.
Don't come to Milwaukee empty handed. Let's end our spectator relationship to life. Come to Milwaukee with the intention of participating in this year's convergence; from there we might learn to become full participants in our lives.
The convergence will surely be a time to relax and enjoy eachothers company, but also to network, learn, share, and teach; to sharpen our daggers. So come with a workshop to teach, a zine to give away, a game to play, a story to tell, a secret to share or a desire to unleash. If we want a world of our own determination, let's start by making a convergence of our own designs. The Crimethinc. Convergence can be whatever we dream it to be, so come prepared to make that a reality.
If you are planning a workshop, or can provide any other vital supplies please email Blowedupwisconsin@gmail.com
Love, The Milwaukee Crimethinc. Urban Sleeper Cell.

I am looking for a ride that is coming from the New England Area. I need a car with a wee-bit of room, as I usually bring a lot of stuff (to share). I can drive (And legally too!), I can also drive stick and am a decently accomplished mechanic, in case we get in trouble. I can also contribute to gas.

I'm also looking for a ride from New England (Central MA). I'm hoping to arrive a little bit prior to the 16th to spend time with friends but I am flexible. I can drive and contribute a little bit to gas, but I would prefer to find someone to hitchhike with and not spend money.
ferrrocious@riseup.net

This just in from Milwaukee about childcare:
Too often, radical parents are left behind and can't participate in projects due to the assumption that childcare is solely their responsibility. Let's make this year's CrimethInc. Convergence a space that is welcoming and supportive to children and parents.
That being said: Parents, how can we serve you? How can we meet your needs? Kidz, what are you excited about? Do you have a game to teach, suggestions for activities, or a workshop you would like to present? Allies, what kind of resources do you have to offer? Can you share your time, musical talents, ideas, art supplies, etc.? Feedback would be appreciated from EVERYBODY! By valuing the involvement/work of radical parents, we form a more vibrant culture of resistance, and we teach the young the vision we want to see of a more equitable future by including them in our activities now.
Contact: kidzresist@yahoo.com
A flier to this effect is available here: http://s93.photobucket.com/albums/l63/stephonini/?action=view&current=childcare-1.jpg

If you have any ideas, if this sounds like a good idea or you would like to contribute please message me. amanda.goodpasture@gmail

Email is cracksoup@gmail.com
Sommmmebody talk at me, I could use a few tips on wisconsin state road laws and cops and hitchhikers... etc.
hello, i'm driving a van from chicago to the convergence on the 16th if anyone in the chicagoland area would like a ride. my email is americalibre at overground dot info

yo rebbecasoup i'm in chapel hill north carolina right now if your looking for a hitching companion let me know kk i sent you a message on you gmail my gmail is Dustin.love.peace.and.anarchy let me know if your interested asap kk thanks
I’m pretty much in the same boat as most, im in need of a ride. Im in MI outside of Detroit area. i dont mind, train, hitching, just need someone to travel with! papertrial99@yahoo.com
so i got a question about the convergence just wondering if anyone has a collective housing set up i need a place to stay after the convergence kinda in a rut at the moment
Is anyone perhaps passing through Montana on their way over there? I suppose not, eh? I would sure like to go.

between the convergence and froseph the west coast is collectively weeping. theres gotta be something to do out here soon because out here gas is 5 bucks a gallon and none of us can get past our cities!
oh well- you know what they say about idle hands!

Kristin, it seems like year after year, there are dozens with your concern — that too many summer activities are so distant from the west coast. It is a valid concern.
You, and others, should know that these activities are bottomlined by people in the midwest. others are bottomlined by people on the east coast. All this to say, the bottomliners will have to come through on the west coast, if there will ever be anything exciting there.
Maybe it illustrates the difference in cultures that the only anarchist festivals and gatherings on the west coast are based in specific cities and cater to communities within those cities, and rarely involve a network of communities from outside one particular city. I'd be curious to hear some discourse about what factors contribute to the difference in regional "gathering" atmospheres.

I am leaving from the area of Ottawa or Montreal. If necessary, I can go to Vermont, to Toronto, to upstate New York, etc. If anyone is coming close to any of the areas I just mentioned, let me know, because I really want to go to this.

anybody else hitching from washington state? im in between bellingham and seattle. if you want another human with you, thatd be great for me cause im all solo right now. no fun. perritosueno@hotmail.com

hey this is love and anarchy just checking to see if there's any fellow hitchhikers headed out to the convergence that are in the kentucky area let me know like matvey77 said it's no fun solo ... well actually i've had some pretty good fun so far it's interesting how so many people live life ^.^
are there any fellow activists who are going to the convergence that are in Dayton,Ohio?
I can't believe that I live a half hour away from locust st. and can't be there.
I am offering a ride from Minneapolis if anyone is down,,,,

Yo flite I would be way down for a ride from mpls. I also have others that would join if could. How much space do you have? I should be back in minneapolis next monday the 14th if you'd want to meet up and chat or something....
Is anyone driving from New England or New York City? I can help drive and contribute money, stories, probably food. Jenine pickupmyglasseye@yahoo.com

lycanhardcore and pickupmyglasseye, i am also seeking traveling companions from the new england area. technically, i will be in VT, but i can easily make my way towards a location that is easier. my primary contribution will be jokes, but i can also give gas money if necessary. please email me with any prospects.
emailaddress@riseup.net
We're going from the Wilamette Valley, Oregon, through SW Washington, N. Idaho, Montana, North Dakota (or South Dakota), and Minnesota. We have room for one or two, depending on luggage.

diomedes, Im headed back twards the willamette area afterwards, i can help with gas if youre not opposed to panhandling.. catch up at the convergence if you can. I'll be the anarchist girl with the backpack.
Just in case you dont see any of those... 704-904-9174

Hey I'm going to the convergence from Bloomington, Illinois (I'm originally from Pittsburgh, and this is the farthest I've made it so far). I was wondering if anyone would like to hitch west with me? Or if you're feeling very generous, give me a ride west (Seattleish). I can't help out with gas money but I know a lot of good stories and can sing songs and entertain you. If anyone is interested or even has a place I can crash out west, call or email. 724-963-7379 gathered.ghosts@gmail.com

Hey all,
I'm looking for a ride from New Orleans, can help with gas and driving. Send me an e-mail if I can tag along: lobsterbeard@gmail.com
Thanks!

HELP!!!!!!!!!!! Okay, I dont want to ride greyhound, and even if I did I have very little money. I am looking for a ride from Austin,MN, which is located in the SE portion of the state. Interstate 90 goes right through Austin, and is about 4-5 hours from Milwaukee. my email is soitgoes@riseup.net my phone # is 612-860-6389 I am down for paying for gas and whatever else. gracias

I'm in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada and I want to come down for the convergence. Life would be a lot easier if I could get a ride, pretty much anywhere between Winnipeg and the park.
Email: iwishicouldwaterbend@gmail.com
Alex

Things have changed. I am in Sault Ste. Marie, on the border of Canada and the U.S. I wanna cross. I could pay three hundred bucks for a Greyhound return ticket, or I could try to get a ride. Maybe I'll just bus a short way and hitch the rest.
But if you're on your way this way from Toronto...

Still have room diomedes?
Any chance you could roll through Seattle?
If not, how close are you coming to it, and when?
I'm in the chicago area and I'd like a ride to the convergence! is anyone headed out that way from this point if so call my cell it's 252-622-2244
I am trying to get to Chicago. I would love a ride, as well. I am now across the border - after a lot of hassles - in Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan.

We embarked today and then got a speeding ticket while still in Salem, Oregon. I had a warrant but they didn't arrest me, but now we don't have enough gas money. My companion is afraid to hitch, so I think we're just gonna have our own miniture-scaled convergence with people we know. I'm sorry to people who need rides. This means that whoever goes need to have more fun to compensate for us.
I'm coming from Kalamazoo, MI, driving through Chicago... I might have some extra room. avecaccent@gmail.com
In Green Bay... Still trying to get there.

Okay, tomorrow I am leaving austin at about 400 am central standard. I will take I-90 to I-94 obviously both heading east. If anyone finds themselves heading down these roads towards milwaukee give me a call. I know there are safety issues involved with calling someone that could be a cop, but there are also safety issues involved with hiking 300 some miles. my number is already up so please give me a call. My computer access is quite limited so phone is the only way, sorry.
anyone coming from detroit area? im still looking for a travel buddy or two. papertrial99@yahoo.com
